intro: Psychotria peduncularis var. hypsophila, commonly known as the highland psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, where it thrives in humid, high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to cool, shaded conditions. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
